PropertyList.verbose-help: For a complete list of options use --help --verbose
PropertyList.help-desc: Show the most relevant command line options
PropertyList.verbose-desc: Show all command line options when combined with --help or -h
PropertyList.version-desc: Enable/Disable display the current FlightGear version
PropertyList.fg-aircraft-desc: Specify additional aircraft directory path(s) (alternatively, you can use --aircraft-dir to target a specific aircraft in a given directory)
PropertyList.download-dir-desc: Base directory to use for aircraft and scenery downloads (the TerraSync scenery directory may be specifically set with --terrasync-dir)
PropertyList.language-desc: Select the language for this session
PropertyList.load-tape-desc: Load recording of earlier FlightGear session. For <name>, if <name> ends with .fgdata it is treated as the local path of the recording file; otherwise we form the local path by prepending <name> with the tape directory and appending ".fgtape". For <url> (starting with http:// or https://) we download the remote recording (which must be a Continuous recording) in the background to a url-dependent filename while replaying it; if the url-dependent filename already exists it is assumed to be a truncated download and we only download any remaining data.
PropertyList.load-tape-create-video: Enable/Disable encode video while replaying tape specified by --load-tape
PropertyList.load-tape-fixed-dt: Set fixed-dt mode while replaying tape specified by --load-tape
PropertyList.restore-defaults-desc: Enable/Disable resetting all user settings to their defaults (rendering options etc.)
PropertyList.save-on-exit: Enable/Disable saving preferences at program exit
PropertyList.mouse-pointer-desc: (i.e. for full screen Voodoo based cards)
PropertyList.real-weather-fetch-desc: Enable/Disable METAR based real weather fetching
PropertyList.metar-desc: Pass a METAR string to set up static weather (this implies --disable-real-weather-fetch)
PropertyList.ai-models-desc: Enable/Disable AI subsystem (required for multi-player, AI traffic and many other animations.) Disabling it is deprecated.
PropertyList.ai-scenario: Add and enable a new scenario. Multiple options are allowed.
PropertyList.freeze-desc: Enable/Disable start in a frozen state
PropertyList.browser-app-desc: Specify path to your web browser
PropertyList.prop-desc: Set property <name> to <value>. <type> can be one of string, double, float, long, int, or bool
PropertyList.prop-browser-desc: After starting the simulator, immediately open the properties dialog with the given property
PropertyList.no-default-config-desc: Enable/Disable not loading any default configuration files (like .fgfsrc) unless explicitly specified with --config
PropertyList.allow-nasal-read-desc: Allow Nasal scripts to read files from directories listed as path (separate multiple paths with a semicolon (Windows) or a colon (UNIX)). By default, for security reasons, Nasal scripts can only read data from certain directories, such as $FG_ROOT, $FG_HOME, etc.
PropertyList.ignore-autosave-desc: Enable/Disable ignoring the autosave file, i.e. the settings saved in this file will not be loaded during startup, nor will the settings be saved to this file when closing the simulator
PropertyList.json-report-desc: Enable/Disable printing a report in JSON format on the standard output, giving information such as the FlightGear version, $FG_ROOT, $FG_HOME, aircraft and scenery paths, etc.
PropertyList.gui-desc: Enable/Disable GUI (disabling GUI enables headless mode)
PropertyList.jsbsim-output-directive-file-desc: Log JSBSim properties in a CSV file. An output directives file contains an <output type="CSV"></output> element, within which should be specified the parameters or parameter groups that should be logged.
PropertyList.data-desc: Specify an additional base data directory (FGData), before the $FG_ROOT directory
PropertyList.restart-launcher-desc: Enable/Disable automatic opening of the Launcher when exiting FlightGear
PropertyList.aircraft-desc: Select an aircraft profile as defined by a top level <name>-set.xml
PropertyList.show-aircraft-desc: Print a list of the currently available aircraft types
PropertyList.min-aircraft-status: Allows you to define a minimum status level (=development status) for all listed aircraft
PropertyList.state-desc: Specify the initial state of the aircraft to the given value
PropertyList.fdm-desc: Select the core flight dynamics model
Can be one of jsb, larcsim, yasim, magic, balloon, ada, external, or null
PropertyList.aero-desc: Select aircraft aerodynamics model to load
PropertyList.model-hz-desc: Run the FDM this rate (iterations per second)
PropertyList.speed-desc: Run the FDM 'n' times faster than real time
PropertyList.notrim-desc: Enable/Disable not attempting to trim the model
PropertyList.on-ground-desc: Enable/Disable starting at ground level (default enabled)
PropertyList.in-air-desc: Enable/Disable starting in air (implied when using --altitude)
PropertyList.wind-desc: Specify wind coming from DIR (degrees) at SPEED (knots)
PropertyList.random-wind-desc: Set up random wind direction and speed
PropertyList.ceiling-desc: Create an overcast ceiling, optionally with a specific thickness (defaults to 2000 ft).
PropertyList.aircraft-dir-desc: Specify the exact directory to use for the aircraft (normally not required, but may be useful). Interpreted relatively to the current directory. Causes the <path-cache> from autosave_X_Y.xml, as well as --fg-aircraft and the FG_AIRCRAFT environment variable to be bypassed.
PropertyList.airport-desc: Specify starting position relative to an airport
PropertyList.parking-id-desc: Specify parking position at an airport (must also specify an airport)
PropertyList.carrier-desc: Specify starting position on an AI carrier
PropertyList.carrier-position-desc: Specify a starting position relative to the carrier where you can use the predefined abeam (start on downwind abeam) or FLOLS (start on final approach) values, or specify the name of the carrier's parking position. Must also specify a carrier.
PropertyList.vor-desc: Specify starting position relative to a VOR
PropertyList.vor-freq-desc: Specify the frequency of the VOR. Use with --vor=ID
PropertyList.ndb-desc: Specify starting position relative to an NDB
PropertyList.ndb-freq-desc: Specify the frequency of the NDB. Use with --ndb=ID
PropertyList.fix-desc: Specify starting position relative to a fix
PropertyList.runway-no-desc: Specify starting runway (must also specify an airport)
PropertyList.offset-distance-desc: Specify distance to reference point (nautical miles)
PropertyList.uBody-desc: Specify velocity along the body X axis
PropertyList.vBody-desc: Specify velocity along the body Y axis
PropertyList.wBody-desc: Specify velocity along the body Z axis
PropertyList.vNorth-desc: Specify velocity along a South-North axis
PropertyList.vEast-desc: Specify velocity along a West-East axis
PropertyList.vDown-desc: Specify velocity along a vertical axis
PropertyList.glideslope-desc: Specify flight path angle (can be positive)
PropertyList.roc-desc: Specify initial climb rate (can be negative)
PropertyList.hold-short-desc: Enable/Disable the move to hold short position for multiplayer
PropertyList.show-sound-devices-desc: Show a list of available audio device
PropertyList.sound-device-desc: Explicitly specify the audio device to use
PropertyList.graphics-preset-desc: Set graphic options from one of the presets
PropertyList.compositor-desc: Specify the path to XML file for multi-pass rendering. The path is relative to $FG_ROOT (defaults to Compositor/default.xml).
PropertyList.horizon-effect-desc: Enable/Disable celestial body growth illusion near the horizon
PropertyList.specular-highlight-desc: Enable/Disable specular reflections on textured objects
PropertyList.arm-desc: Specify a multiplier for the aspect ratio.
PropertyList.materials-file-desc: Specify the materials file used to render the scenery (default: Materials/regions/materials.xml)
PropertyList.texture-filtering-desc: Anisotropic Texture Filtering: values should be 1 (default), 2, 4, 8 or 16
PropertyList.view-offset-desc: Specify the default forward view direction as an offset from straight ahead. Allowable values are LEFT, RIGHT, CENTER, or a specific number in degrees
PropertyList.visibility-miles-desc: Specify initial visibility in statute miles
PropertyList.texture-cache-dir-desc: Specify the DDS texture cache directory to be different than the default location
PropertyList.terrain-engine-desc: Specify the terrain engine you want to use: tilecache or pagedLOD
PropertyList.lod-levels-desc: Specify the detail levels, where levels are a space-separated numeric list of levels. The default is "1 3 5 7 9".
PropertyList.lod-res-desc: Specify the resolution of the terrain grid. Defaults is 1.
PropertyList.lod-texturing-desc: Specify the method of texturing the terrain. The default is bluemarble.
PropertyList.lod-range-mult-desc: Specify the range multiplier (point from low to fine detail). Defaults is 2.
PropertyList.hud-tris-desc: Hud displays number of triangles rendered
PropertyList.hud-culled-desc: Hud displays percentage of triangles culled
PropertyList.time-match-local-desc: Synchronize time with local real-world time
PropertyList.start-date-desc: Specify a starting date/time with respect to
PropertyList.httpd-desc: Enable http server on the specified address. Specify the port or address:port to bind to.
PropertyList.proxy-desc: Specify which proxy server (and port) to use. The username and password are optional and should be MD5 encoded already. This option is only useful when used in conjunction with the real-weather-fetch option.
PropertyList.telnet-desc: Enable telnet server on the specified port
PropertyList.jpg-httpd-desc: Enable screen shot http server on the specified port (replaced by --httpd)
PropertyList.terrasync-dir-desc: Set target directory for scenery downloads
PropertyList.allow-nasal-from-sockets-desc: Enable/Disable security flag. Enable means that network connections will be allowed full access to the simulator including running arbitrary scripts. Ensure you have adequate security (such as a firewall which blocks external connections).
PropertyList.sentry-desc: Enable/Disable crash and error reports from being sent to the development team for analysis
PropertyList.callsign-desc: Assign a unique name to a player
PropertyList.wp-desc: Specify a waypoint for the GC autopilot;
PropertyList.flight-plan-desc: Read all waypoints from a file
PropertyList.AV400-desc: Emit the Garmin AV400 protocol required to drive a Garmin 196/296 series GPS
PropertyList.AV400Sim-desc: Emit the set of AV400 strings required to drive a Garmin 400-series GPS from FlightGear
PropertyList.AV400WSimA-desc: Open connection for "A" channel using Garmin WAAS GPS protocol
PropertyList.AV400WSimB-desc: Open connection for "B" channel using Garmin WAAS GPS protocol
PropertyList.atlas-desc: Open connection using the Atlas protocol
PropertyList.atcsim-desc: Open connection using the ATC sim protocol (atc610x)
PropertyList.flarm-desc: Open connection using the Flarm protocol, which includes NMEA/GPS and traffic reporting messages
PropertyList.garmin-desc: Open connection using the Garmin GPS protocol
PropertyList.igc-desc: Open connection using the International Gliding Commission protocol
PropertyList.joyclient-desc: Open connection to an Agwagon joystick
PropertyList.jsclient-desc: Open connection to a remote joystick
PropertyList.native-ctrls-desc: Open connection using the FG Native Controls protocol
PropertyList.native-fdm-desc: Open connection using the FG Native FDM protocol
PropertyList.native-gui-desc: Open connection using the FG Native GUI protocol
PropertyList.native-desc: Open connection using the FG Native protocol
PropertyList.nmea-desc: Open connection using the NMEA protocol
PropertyList.generic-desc: Open connection using a predefined communication interface and a preselected communication protocol
PropertyList.opengc-desc: Open connection using the OpenGC protocol
PropertyList.props-desc: Open connection using the interactive property manager
PropertyList.pve-desc: Open connection using the PVE protocol
PropertyList.ray-desc: Open connection using the Ray Woodworth motion chair protocol
PropertyList.rul-desc: Open connection using the RUL protocol
PropertyList.nav1-desc: Set the NAV1 radio frequency, optionally preceded by a radial.
PropertyList.nav2-desc: Set the NAV2 radio frequency, optionally preceded by a radial.
PropertyList.adf1-desc: Set the ADF1 radio frequency, optionally preceded by a card rotation.
PropertyList.adf2-desc: Set the ADF2 radio frequency, optionally preceded by a card rotation.
PropertyList.dme-desc: Slave the DME to one of the NAV radios, or set its internal frequency.
PropertyList.failure-desc: Fail the pitot, static, vacuum, or electrical system (repeat the option for multiple system failures).
PropertyList.fpe-desc: Enable/Disable aborting on encountering a floating point exception
PropertyList.fgviewer-desc: Use a model viewer rather than load the entire simulator
PropertyList.trace-read-desc: Trace the reads for a property;
PropertyList.trace-write-desc: Trace the writes for a property;
PropertyList.log-level-desc: Specify which logging level to use
PropertyList.log-class-desc: Specify which logging class(es) to use
PropertyList.log-dir-desc: Log to directory DIR. The special value 'desktop' causes logging to the desktop (OS-dependent location). This option may be given several times, using a different value each time. Inside the specified directory, the written log file is named FlightGear_YYYY-MM-DD_<num>.log, where <num> takes the values 0, 1, 2, etc.
PropertyList.uninstall-desc: Remove $FG_HOME directory. For Windows, it additionally removes TerraSync, Aircraft and TextureCache directories from download directory.
